(Same as MESAS 370 3)
This course will provide students an overview of the ways in which Islam influences domestic and foreign policy decision-making in the Middle East and United States. To that end, it will involve thematic discussions of the interplay between Islam and political structures, the involvement of Muslim populations in government and opposition movements, and comprehensive discussion of key historical moments highlighting the relationship between Islam and political structures since the start of the twentieth century .
course_description: A broad introduction to the relationship between Islam and politics in twentieth-century Iran, the Middle East, and North Africa.
